author: sussman
msg: Make dist.sh detect the revnum again.

author: sussman
msg: Karl is writing a Tolstoyan essay on the theoretical problems we have
with directories being out-of-date.  In the meantime, we can make
Hudson test #11 pass over dav by making the *client* side enforce the
rule: "dir propchanges are only committable on up-to-date dirs".
The commit-driver now uses a callback (from the RA layer) to get the
latest revision number from the repository, so it can do an up-to-date
check on any directory with propchanges.  For now, this means that any
commit that contains changes directory props results in one extra
network turnaround (in the case of multiple dirs having propchanges,
the latest revision number is cached).  We can live with this.
* svn_ra.h (svn_ra_get_latest_revnum_func_t):  new function type.
* svn_wc.h (svn_wc_crawl_local_mods):  add this function type to this
declaration.
* adm_crawler.c (svn_wc_crawl_local_mods):  take new function type,
and 'youngest_rev' cache field.
(svn_wc__crawl_local_mods):  take new function type and youngest_rev
(crawl_dir): same; actually use the new function and cache variable
to check directory out-of-dateness.
* commit.c (send_to_repos):  pass RA->get_latest_revnum to the
crawler, or NULL in the xml commit case.
* commit-test.c (main): pass NULL to the crawler here. (it's an xml test)
* commit_tests.py (hudson_part_2):  make commit-test #11 look for the
new error message.
